doc.title: Timer
doc.desc: The Timer class is a class for generating events at regular intervals.

member.name: Timer

argitem.name: owner
argitem.desc: Specifies the target for event generation.

argitem.name: actionname
argitem.desc: Specifies the name of the method to receive events in the object specified by owner. If an empty string is specified, owner is treated as a method, and owner is called directly at each event interval.

member.desc: Constructs a Timer class object. In the initial state, the interval property is 1000 and the enabled property is false.

member.name: interval
member.desc: Represents the event generation interval. You can also set the value. The unit is ms (milliseconds), and events occur at the specified time intervals. You can also specify the interval as a real number. In the current version, it can be specified with a precision of 1/65536 milliseconds (values after the decimal point are rounded to this precision). Even though it has a precision of about 1/65536 milliseconds, there is no guarantee that the event handler will actually be called with this precision. In practice, there is a fluctuation of about 3 to 10 ms in the timing of event calls. However, in the average and long term, adjustments are automatically made so that events occur at the interval specified by this property.

member.name: capacity
member.desc: Specifies how many events can be generated at one time. You can also set the value. There may be cases where timer events cannot be fully processed, such as when processing takes longer than the timer interval. In this case, the timer stores events in the event queue, but there is an upper limit to the number of events that can be stored in that event queue. This property specifies that maximum number. When it comes time to process events, Kirikiri attempts to process the number of events accumulated in the queue at once. If 1 is specified, a maximum of only 1 event will accumulate in the event queue. If 0 is specified, there is no limit to the number of events that can accumulate in the event queue, but be careful as the system may appear to freeze if too many events accumulate. The default is 6.

member.name: enabled
member.desc: Indicates whether to generate events. You can also set the value. If true, events will occur. If false, events will not occur.

member.name: mode
member.desc: Represents the operation mode. You can also set the value. Specify one of the following values. atmNormal : Events are delivered with normal event delivery priority. atmExclusive : Delivered with priority over other asynchronous events. atmAtIdle : Delivered in the idle state (when there are no other events to deliver).
